On the other hand, ethnobotanical information is of high cultural importance and of great socio-economic value to researchers, politicians, and the local populations
13 . This knowledge is being eroded due to the decline of custodians of indigenous knowledge and the lack of interest of the younger generation to this knowledge
14 . Therefore, researchers should look for approaches for applying and institutionalizing the indigenous knowledge of different pastorals in the plans and adopted policies.
